excerpt: Massive public square featuring a central island surrounded by 70+ statues of historic residents.
detail_description: Prato della Valle in Padua is a grand public square with a central island encircled by an elliptical canal called the Alicorn, adorned with over 70 statues of notable figures. Commissioned in the 18th century, it serves as a venue for various events, fairs, concerts, and markets. This bustling square is frequented by students, artists seeking inspiration, and fitness enthusiasts who utilize the surrounding 'asphalt ribbon' for running and skating.
name: Prato della Valle
address: 35141 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Chapel lined with renowned early-14th century frescoes by Giotto, plus film documentary.
detail_description: The Scrovegni Chapel, also known as the Arena Chapel, is a must-see attraction in Padua. Commissioned by Enrico Scrovegni in the early 14th century, this chapel is adorned with vibrant frescoes painted by Giotto di Bondone between 1303 and 1305. The chapel's rich history and stunning artwork make it an essential stop for art enthusiasts. Additionally, visitors can explore the nearby gardens and museum for a comprehensive experience.
name: Scrovegni Chapel
address: Piazza Eremitani, 8, 35121 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Padua is a city in Northern Italy’s Veneto region. It’s known for the frescoes by Giotto in its Scrovegni Chapel from 1303–05 and the vast 13th-century Basilica of St. Anthony. The basilica, with its Byzantine-style domes and notable artworks, contains the namesake saint’s tomb. In Padua's old town are arcaded streets and stylish cafes frequented by students of the University of Padua, established in 1222.
detail_description: Padua, a city in Northern Italy's Veneto region, is renowned for its cultural and historical landmarks. The Scrovegni Chapel houses remarkable frescoes by Giotto, while the Basilica of St. Anthony features Byzantine-style domes and significant artworks, including the saint's tomb. The old town boasts charming arcaded streets and trendy cafes popular among students from the University of Padua, established in 1222.
name: Padua
address: Province of Padua, Italy

excerpt: Byzantine-style domes top this vast Catholic edifice, home to noted artworks & St Antony's relics.
detail_description: The Basilica of St. Anthony is a magnificent Catholic church with Byzantine-style domes and notable artworks, including relics of St. Anthony. Constructed in Gothic style shortly after the saint's death in 1232, it attracts pilgrims from around the world who come to pay homage to the revered friar. The interior is a labyrinth of chapels and corridors housing masterpieces such as Donatello's reliefs on the high altar and expressive sculptural narratives of St.
name: The Basilica of St. Anthony
address: Piazza del Santo, 11, 35123 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: The world's oldest academic garden, founded by Benedictine monks and containing over 3,500 species.
detail_description: The University of Padua Botanical Garden, also known as Orto Botanico di Padova, is the oldest academic garden in the world. Established in 1545 by Benedictine monks and later included in UNESCO's World Heritage List, it has played a crucial role in the development of various scientific disciplines such as botany, chemistry, ecology, and pharmaceuticals.
name: University of Padua Botanical Garden
address: Via Orto Botanico, 15, 35123 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Renaissance palazzo & elegant anatomy theatre, part of the city's university, for guided tours.
detail_description: Palazzo Bo is a Renaissance palace and home to an elegant anatomy theater, forming part of the city's university. Originally owned by the Papafava family, it was later gifted to a butcher in 1405 for supplying meat during a siege. The building housed an inn before becoming the university in 1539. The name "Palazzo del Bo" persists due to the university's decision to preserve a bull's skull as part of its emblem.
name: Palazzo Bo
address: Via VIII Febbraio, 2, 35122 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Venerable multi-faculty public educational institution, founded in 1222, with over 60,000 students.
detail_description: The University of Padua, established in 1222, is a renowned public educational institution with a rich history and over 60,000 students. It holds the distinction of being one of Italy's oldest and most prestigious universities, attracting students from across the country and beyond. The university's influence has contributed to Padua's vibrant and youthful atmosphere.
name: University of Padua
address: Via VIII Febbraio, 2, 35122 Padova PD, Italy

detail_description: Casa del custode dell'Orto Botanico, also known as the house of the keeper of the botanical garden, has a fascinating history. Originally established by Benedictine monks, it was later protected by Luigi Squalermo, who noticed theft and even poisonous plants in the garden. To safeguard it, an oval protective wall was constructed in 1552.
name: Casa del custode dell'Orto Botanico
address: Università degli Studi di Padova, Orto botanico, Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Catholic cathedral & basilica dating to the 13th century with a simple interior & ornate altar.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Piazza del Duomo, Padua Cathedral, or Duomo di Padova, is a remarkable testament to centuries of architectural evolution. Originally established in the 4th century and consecrated in 1075, this stunning structure underwent significant renovations that culminated in its current form during the late 16th century under renowned artists like Michelangelo.
name: Padua Cathedral
address: Piazza Duomo, 35139 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Multi-floor museum housing collections of historic furniture, ceramics, textiles, coins & medals.
detail_description: Palazzo Zuckermann is a captivating museum located in Padua, Italy. It is housed in an impressive twentieth-century building and features multi-floor exhibitions showcasing historic furniture, ceramics, textiles, coins, and medals. The museum is part of the Civic Museum of Padua and includes collections from Museo di Arti Applicate e Decorative and Museo Bottacin. Visitors can explore elegant twin squares nearby along with other historic landmarks such as the Roman Arena and the Scrovegni Chapel.
name: Palazzo Zuckermann
address: Corso Giuseppe Garibaldi, 33, 35122 Padova PD, Italy

detail_description: Piazza dei Signori is a stunning square that stands out for its exceptional beauty. It is a bustling hub of activity, attracting both locals and tourists who come to enjoy sightseeing and various adventures. Over the years, it has been a prominent location for civic celebrations, tournaments, and public gatherings due to its remarkable architecture.
name: Piazza dei Signori
address: 35139 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Museum with interactive exhibits on human anatomy, surgical tools & the history of local medicine.
detail_description: Nestled in the historic heart of Padua, MUSME, or the Museum of the History of Medicine, is a captivating destination that opened its doors in 2015. Housed within the ancient Hospital of San Francesco, this museum offers an engaging journey through time with interactive exhibits that delve into human anatomy and surgical tools. Visitors can explore fascinating artifacts from as far back as the 18th century, including vintage surgical instruments and antique pharmacy displays.
name: MUSME
address: Via S. Francesco, 94, 35121 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Quartiere dell’Antico Ghetto Ebraico, the old Jewish ghetto, is a charming area with narrow, winding streets and the Museo della Padova Ebraica, housing ritual objects. Cobbled Piazzetta del Ghetto is a small, picturesque square, home to wine and cocktail bars with terraces and live music. Artisanal shops sell handicrafts and clothing on Via S. Martino e Solferino, and cozy bistros serve homemade Italian classics.
detail_description: The District of the Ancient Jewish Ghetto, also known as the Ghetto, is a picturesque area in Padua with narrow streets and the Museo della Padova Ebraica, showcasing ritual objects. The Piazzetta del Ghetto offers charming wine and cocktail bars with live music. Visitors can explore artisanal shops on Via S. Martino e Solferino and enjoy homemade Italian dishes at cozy bistros.
name: District of the Ancient Jewish Ghetto
address: Padua, Province of Padua, Italy

excerpt: Storied, colonnaded plaza overlooked by an imposing medieval palace, home to a daily produce market.
detail_description: Piazza delle Erbe is a historic square with a rich past, featuring impressive architecture and a daily market offering fresh produce. To reach this bustling plaza, take Via Cavour and explore nearby attractions like Piazza Cavour, Caffe Pedrocchi, and Palazzo Bo before turning right into Piazza delle Erbe. Here you can admire the grand Ragione Palace, Piazza dei Signori, and Loggia dell Guardia.
name: Piazza delle Erbe
address: Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Picturesque public square offering a market & events in front of the landmark clock tower.
detail_description: The Piazza dei Signori is a beautiful public square in Padova, Italy that features a market and events in front of the landmark clock tower. The square is popular for its stunning architecture and historic significance, and it is a great place to take a break and enjoy some free time. The buildings in Padova have been lightened in December 2021, so it's an even more photogenic spot!
name: Piazza dei Signori
address: 35139 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Renowned site & observatory featuring a tall tower & historic exhibits on astrological studies.
detail_description: Museo La Specola, the museum of the Astronomical Observatory of Padua is a renowned site featuring a tall tower and historic exhibits on astrological studies. The tower, also known as the tower of Galileo, was used for astronomical observations starting from 1767. It is now part of the National Institute of Astrophysics and has been transformed into an astronomy museum showcasing ancient instruments.
name: Museo La Specola, il museo dell'Osservatorio Astronomico di Padova
address: Vicolo dell'Osservatorio, 5, 35122 Padova PD, Italy

detail_description: Piazza dei Signori is a charming square located in the heart of the city. It is surrounded by elegant buildings and historical landmarks, creating a picturesque setting for visitors to explore. The atmosphere is lively, with bustling cafes and restaurants offering delicious local cuisine. The square is steeped in history and culture, making it a must-visit destination for anyone interested in the heritage of the area. With its beautiful architecture and vibrant ambiance, Piazza dei Signori captures the essence of this captivating city.
name: Piazza dei Signori
address: 35139 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Bustling square known for its fruit-&-vegetable market, 12th-century tower & historic city court.
detail_description: Piazza della Frutta is a lively square in the historic city, known for its vibrant fruit and vegetable market, as well as its 12th-century tower and historic city court. Adjacent to Piazza delle Erbe, this bustling square offers a variety of dining options, including All'Ombra della Piazza, a charming eatery serving delectable finger foods like fried calamari, shrimp, small pizzas, calzones, and more.
name: Piazza della frutta
address: Piazza della Frutta, 36, 35100 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Museum featuring Roman & pre-Roman artifacts along with artwork from the 14th—18th centuries.
detail_description: The Eremitani Museums, located near the Cappella degli Scrovegni, offer a diverse collection of artifacts and artwork spanning different periods. The former monastery boasts beautiful cloister gardens adorned with ancient architectural fragments and modern sculptures. Inside, the Pinacoteca showcases medieval and modern masterpieces by renowned artists such as Tintoretto, Veronese, and Tiepolo.
name: Eremitani Museums
address: Piazza Eremitani, 8, 35121 Padova PD, Italy

detail_description: In the heart of the town center, you'll find the impressive Palazzo del Capitanio, a historic building that once served as the seat of a Venetian captain during Padua's time under Venetian rule. The grand architecture includes a striking clock tower at its center, one of the oldest in Europe. Nearby, you can also explore Palazzo Bo, which houses the main headquarters of the ancient University of Padua and showcases architectural styles spanning several centuries.
name: Palazzo del Capitanio
address: Piazza Capitaniato, 3, 35139 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Riverside, early 1900s gardens featuring an ancient Roman amphitheater & a medieval chapel.
detail_description: Giardini dell'Arena is a picturesque park located in the heart of Padova, alongside the tranquil Piovego canal. It features an ancient Roman amphitheater and the renowned Cappella degli Scrovegni, a 14th-century church adorned with breathtaking frescoes by Giotto. Once considered unsafe, the gardens have been transformed into a charming space suitable for leisurely strolls, family picnics, and organized activities by the University of Padua.
name: Giardini dell'Arena
address: Corso Giuseppe Garibaldi, 35121 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: 13th-century church housing the remains of Mantegna's landmark fresco cycle, destroyed in WWII.
detail_description: Chiesa degli Eremitani is a 13th-century church in Padova, Italy, known for housing the remains of Mantegna's fresco cycle, which was unfortunately destroyed during WWII. The church is located near the Scrovegni Chapel and its gardens, as well as the Museum opposite. Visitors can explore the Archeological Museum, Picture Gallery, and Multimedia Room at the Civic Museum just behind the church.
name: Chiesa degli Eremitani
address: Piazza Eremitani, 9, 35129 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Famed bronze statue by Renaissance artist Donatello featuring a warrior on horseback.
detail_description: Donatello's bronze equestrian statue of Gattamelata features a powerful warrior on horseback. It is one of the most famous and beautiful Christian sights in Padua, dating back to the 13th century. The statue is located in front of the cathedral, and is a must see for art lovers. The cathedral has a pious policy about clothing, which makes it even more interesting and beautiful.
name: Equestrian statue of Gattamelata
address: Piazza del Santo, 35123 Padova PD, Italy

detail_description: Piazza del Santo is a charming square located in the heart of Padua, Italy. It is known for its historical significance and beautiful architecture. The piazza is home to the famous Basilica of Saint Anthony, a stunning church that attracts visitors from all over the world. Surrounding the square, there are quaint cafes and shops where you can immerse yourself in the local culture. The lively atmosphere and picturesque surroundings make Piazza del Santo a must-visit destination for anyone exploring Padua.
name: Piazza del Santo
address: 35123 Padova PD, Italy

detail_description: The Diocesan Museum of Padua is a remarkable cultural gem nestled within the historic Palazzo Vescovile, which once served as the residence for bishops since the 15th century. This museum offers an impressive collection of art and artifacts that reflect the rich heritage of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Padua. Visitors can marvel at stunning frescoes, including a breathtaking cycle in the Bishops Hall, and explore works from various periods that highlight both religious significance and artistic mastery.
name: Diocesan Museum of Padua
address: Piazza Duomo, 12, 35139 Padova PD, Italy

detail_description: This catholic church from the XIV century is quite large and impressive, with a crucifixion by Donatello and an altar of the Virgin of Sorrows by G. Bonazza. Inside, it's quite peaceful and holy place for prayer.
name: Church of Santa Maria dei Servi, Padua
address: Vicolo dei Servi, 2, 35122 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Grand city institution dating from the 1800s, serving coffee & cocktails, savory dishes & desserts.
detail_description: Pedrocchi Café is a grand institution in the heart of the city, with a history dating back to the 1800s. It offers an array of delights, from coffee and cocktails to savory dishes and desserts. The café played a significant role in the 1848 riots against the Habsburg monarchy and has been frequented by notable artists over the years. Its stately ground floor exudes old-world charm, while its three columned rooms pay homage to Italy's national colors.
name: Pedrocchi Café
address: Via VIII Febbraio, 15, 35122 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Time-tested assortment of vintage physics & scientific instruments in a historic setting.
detail_description: The Museum of the History of Physics, also known as MUSME, is a fascinating destination for those interested in vintage physics and scientific instruments. Located in Padua, near one of the most renowned Medical Universities in the world, this museum offers a time-tested assortment of original machinery and equipment used by scientists to study various phenomena. The collections include books, scientific instruments, didactic tools, and even furniture from different periods.
name: Museum of the History of Physics
address: Via Leonardo Loredan, 10, 35131 Padova PD, Italy

detail_description: Caffe Pedrocchi is a true gem nestled in the heart of Padua, renowned for its rich history and vibrant atmosphere. Often referred to as the "Cafe without Doors," this iconic establishment was open 24/7 from 1831 until 1916, making it a beloved gathering spot for intellectuals, students, and politicians alike. Its prime location near Piazza dei Signori and Ragione Palace adds to its allure, inviting visitors to soak in both culture and coffee.
name: Caffè Pedrocchi
address: Via Guglielmo Oberdan, 2, 35122 Padova PD, Italy

detail_description: Ponte Molino Gate is a stunning Roman bridge that spans the Bacchiglione River in Padua. This 13th-century city gate, one of only two remaining from the original 19, offers a glimpse into the city's medieval past. The name 'Mill Gate' reflects its historical association with floating mills in the area. With a tower reaching almost 26 meters in height, it features both large and small openings for vehicles and pedestrians.
name: Ponte Molino Gate
address: Vicolo Ponte Molino, 13, 35137 Padova PD, Italy

detail_description: Direzione Settori Cultura e Musei Civici is a complex of museums and historic sites situated in the heart of Piazza Eremitani, on the outskirts of Padua's historic center. It houses an impressive collection showcasing some of the finest examples of Venetian art spanning from the 12th to the 19th centuries.
name: Direzione Settori Cultura e Musei Civici
address: Via Porciglia, 35, 35121 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Medieval, fresco-filled civic building with a ground floor food market, plus cafes & bars.
detail_description: Ragione Palace, also known as Palazzo della Ragione, is a medieval civic building in Padua that dates back to the 13th century. Originally serving as a court building, it now houses a ground floor food market along with cafes and bars. The top floor features the largest hanging Hall in the world. Adjacent to the palace is Palazzo del Bo, which has been the seat of the University since 1493.
name: Ragione Palace
address: Piazza delle Erbe, 35100 Padova PD, Italy

detail_description: Nestled within the historic Palazzo Angeli in Prato della Valle, the Museum of Precinema is a captivating gem that stands out not only in Italy but also on an international scale. Since its inauguration in 1998, this museum has been dedicated to exploring the fascinating history of precinema, showcasing an impressive array of images and viewing devices that gained popularity from the 18th century onward.
name: Museum of Precinema
address: Prato della Valle, 1/A, 35123 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Spacious, kid-friendly insect museum featuring exhibits on silkworms, bees, butterflies & spiders.
detail_description: Esapolis is a delightful insect museum that offers a spacious and engaging environment for families, especially children eager to learn about the fascinating world of insects. This unique venue showcases an impressive array of exhibits featuring silkworms, bees, butterflies, spiders, and various other species like scorpions and beetles. Established through a collaboration between the Province of Padua and Butterfly Arc, Esapolis stands as Italy's largest exhibition dedicated to entomology.
name: Esapolis
address: Via dei Colli, 28, 35143 Padova PD, Italy

detail_description: The Oratory of Saint Giorgio is a stunning chapel located inside the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore in Rome. The chapel features an incredible fresco cycle by Altichiero da Zevio, and visitors are required to purchase tickets in advance. The overall impression of the chapel is one of incredible beauty and splendour, and it's definitely worth a visit if you're in Rome.
name: Oratory of Saint Giorgio
address: Piazza del Santo, 35123 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Unique complex of Renaissance buildings including a Roman-style theatre & ornate octagonal salon.
detail_description: Loggia e Odeo Cornaro is a remarkable complex of Renaissance buildings in Padua, featuring a Roman-style theatre and an ornate octagonal salon. Built in the early 16th century by architect Giovanni Maria Falconetto for Venetian patron Alvise Cornaro, these structures were venues for elegant entertainments such as plays and musical concerts. Recently restored, the romantically-weathered sandstone has been cleaned to reveal their original beauty.
name: Loggia e Odeo Cornaro
address: Via M. Cesarotti, 37, 35123 Padova PD, Italy

name: Scuola di San Rocco
address: Via Santa Lucia, 59, 35139 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Regional gallery featuring artifacts & displays related to the Italian reunification movement.
detail_description: The Museo del Risorgimento is a regional gallery located in the historic center of Padua, on the first floor of the Pedrocchi cafe. It showcases artifacts and displays related to the Italian reunification movement, covering Padova and Italian history from 1797 through various occupations and wars to the establishment of the Italian Republic in 1948. The museum's main floor features beautiful rooms housing numerous historical finds and documents.
name: Museo del Risorgimento e dell'Età Contemporanea
address: Piazzetta Cappellato Pedrocchi, 35122 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: 10th-century Benedictine abbey with an ornate interior & a collection of notable religious artwork.
detail_description: The Abbazia di Santa Giustina is a 10th-century Benedictine abbey in Padova, Italy. It features an elaborate interior and houses a remarkable collection of religious artwork. Visitors can explore the Scrovegni Chapel, the gardens, and the Museum nearby. The abbey is home to the tombs of several saints including St. Justine, St. Prosdocimus, and St. Maximus as well as relics of apostles such as St. Matthias and St.
name: Abbazia di Santa Giustina
address: Via Giuseppe Ferrari, 2/A, 35123 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Cavernous performing arts venue hosting concerts, ballet & other shows, plus private events.
detail_description: Gran Teatro Geox is a cavernous performing arts venue in Padua, Italy, known for hosting concerts, ballet performances, and other shows. It also serves as a cinema center with large halls capable of accommodating thousands of people at once. Visitors are encouraged to book tickets in advance for movies, shows, and concerts through the official website. The venue hosts world-famous singers and bands for concerts as well as touring musical theatre performances.
name: Gran Teatro Geox
address: Via Giuseppe Tassinari, 1, 35136 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Popular local-art & culture museum in a storied medieval palace resembling a fortress.
detail_description: Palazzo Zabarella is a renowned local art and culture museum housed in a medieval palace that resembles a fortress. As you stroll through the portico galleries, each with its unique features, keep an eye out for distinctive columns like the one adorned with a bas relief of a mocking devil near Palazzo Zabarella. The palace itself boasts a crenelated roof and corner tower, adding to its historic charm.
name: Palazzo Zabarella
address: Via Zabarella, 14, 35121 Padova PD, Italy

name: Planetario di Padova
address: Via Alvise Cornaro, 1, 35128 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Serene complex with a church & shrine honoring a 1900s saint, home to his tomb & confessional cell.
detail_description: Santuario di San Leopoldo Mandić is a serene complex in Padua, Italy, featuring a church and shrine dedicated to the 20th-century saint. The site houses his tomb and confessional cell, making it a significant pilgrimage destination. The church is part of the Capuchin monastery complex and holds historical significance dating back to the early 19th century. Despite being destroyed during World War II, it was rebuilt by architect Giovanni Morasutti.
name: Santuario di San Leopoldo Mandić
address: Piazzale Santa Croce, 44, 35123 Padova PD, Italy

detail_description: Murale by Kenny Random is a collection of captivating street art murals created by the renowned Paduan artist, Kenny Random. His distinctive style often features the silhouette of a man wearing a hat, which can be spotted throughout Padua. While not all of his works are mapped on Google Maps, discovering them adds an element of adventure to the experience. As an esteemed figure in Italy and beyond, Kenny Random's murals contribute to Padua's vibrant street art scene.
name: Murale by Kenny Random
address: Via Nazario Sauro, 2, 35139 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Complex built around a former courthouse, with art displays, concerts & festivals, plus a library.
detail_description: Cultural Center Altinate San Gaetano is a vibrant complex situated in a former courthouse, offering an array of cultural experiences. Visitors can explore art displays, attend concerts and festivals, and access a library within the premises. The site also features the unmissable Scrovegni Chapel and its gardens, as well as the adjacent Museum. Additionally, guests can visit the oldest botanical garden in the world at Orto Botanico.
name: Cultural Center Altinate San Gaetano
address: Via Altinate, 71, 35121 Padova PD, Italy

detail_description: The Catholic Church is a religious organization that worships God through the sacraments. Many people join the Catholic Church to receive help in their prayers and to follow the teachings of Jesus Christ. The church has many branches worldwide, each with its own beliefs and practices.
name: Parish of Saint Sophia
address: Via Santa Sofia, 102, 35121 Padova PD, Italy

detail_description: Arena Romana di Padova, originally connected to the Scrovegni Palace, was once the residence of a banker who wanted to construct a chapel. However, it became a separate building after the municipality purchased it in 1881 and has undergone multiple restoration efforts since then. The ancient amphitheater's walls stand as evidence of Roman influence in Padua and are the sole remaining monument from that era within the city.
name: Arena Romana di Padova
address: Piazza Eremitani, 8, 35121 Padova PD, Italy

detail_description: The Tomb of Anthenor, also known as the Sepulchre of Antenore, is a 13th-century monument located in Piazza Antenore in Padua, Italy. It was built to honor an ancient sarcophagus believed to belong to Antenor, the legendary Trojan warrior and founder of Padua.
name: Tomb of Antenor
address: Piazza Antenore, 35121 Padova PD, Italy

excerpt: Former residence of a 16th-century Venetian ambassador, richly decorated with frescoes & porticoes.
detail_description: Villa Molin, a 16th-century Venetian ambassador's former residence, is adorned with exquisite frescoes and porticoes. It is the first of many significant villas along the Battaglia Canal, reminiscent of those along the Brenta Riviera in style and architecture. Visitors praise the guided tours for their passionate and knowledgeable explanations. The villa offers a captivating journey through Venetian history, art, and architecture near Padua.
name: Villa Molin
address: Via Ponte della Cagna, 106, 35142 Padova PD, Italy

detail_description: San Nicolò is a beautiful ancient church located in the Piazza of the same name in Padua. Dating back to 1088, it is one of the oldest churches in the city and holds an interesting medieval sarcophagus. The church's medieval appearance is actually a result of renovations and restorations over time. Inside, visitors can admire frescoes and preserved graffiti, drawings, and writings on the portal.
name: San Nicolò
address: Via S. Nicolò, 35139 Padova PD, Italy
